DataElement.preferredName: Primary Thyroid Gland Neoplasm Location Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the specific location within the thyroid where the tumor or cancer first developed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Thyroid Gland Neoplasm Anatomic Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary)_A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Relating to anatomy._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Relating to anatomy.:A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated for The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) by request of T. Lichtenberg 1/2011 (JP).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A highly vascular endocrine gland consisting of two lobes, one on either side of the trachea, joined by a narrow isthmus; it produces the thyroid hormones which are concerned in regulating the metabolic rate of the body._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cone-like lobe of the thyroid gland that is located in the left side of the trachea.

Concepts.definition: The cone-like lobe of the thyroid gland that is located in the left side of the trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conical thyroid gland lobe.  When it is present, it usually arises from the isthmus.

Concepts.definition: A conical thyroid gland lobe.  When it is present, it usually arises from the isthmus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The narrow, central portion of the thyroid gland that crosses the trachea anteriorly and connects the two lobes of the gland.

Concepts.definition: The narrow, central portion of the thyroid gland that crosses the trachea anteriorly and connects the lateral lobes of the gland. When present, the normal variant pyramidal lobe may extend from the isthmus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cone-like lobe of the thyroid gland that is located in the right side of the trachea.

Concepts.definition: The cone-like lobe of the thyroid gland that is located in the right side of the trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.
An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.
